intro: Rhododendron kotschyi f. album, commonly known as the White-flowered Kotschyi Rhododendron, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its foliage consists of dark green, leathery leaves that are densely packed on sturdy, upright stems. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in specialized gardens due to its specific environmental requirements.
